newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian bullion market closed for holiday.
newsitem.headline: Indian bullion market closed for holiday.

text.p: The Bombay bullion market was closed on Thursday for a local holiday.
On Wednesday, gold 24 carat closed five rupees lower at 4,760 rupees per 10 grammes against the previous close but up five rupees from the open as some seasonal wedding demand emerged.
Prices of gold biscuits (116.50 grammes) closed steady at 55,700 rupees per piece after opening 100 rupees lower compared to the previous close of 55,700 rupees.
Silver (.999) closed 30 rupees lower at 6,850 rupees per kg against the previous close of 6,880 rupees as a setback in world markets moved local prices downwards.
